body.name: DAPU Pure Linen Sheets Set, 100% French Linen from Normandy, Breathable and Durable for Hot Sleepers, 4 Pcs Set - 1 Flat Sheet, 1 Fitted Sheet, 2 Pillowcases (Natural Linen, Queen)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 15. Order within 7 hrs 10 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 15. Order within 17 hrs 55 mins

climatePledgeFriendly.details: OEKO-TEX STANDARD 100 requires textiles-based products to be tested against a list of 1,000+ chemicals, to limit those which may be harmful to human health. Certification focus: #ProductSafety and #ChemicalsUsed.

features: 100% French Natural Linen—DAPU pure linen sheets set is made exclusively from high quality French grown flax from Normandy, naturally grown and processed without chemicals or additives, harvested in an environmentally friendly manner.

Stone washed for glossiness, fine durability as well as soft hand feeling. Manufactured with an OEKO-TEX Standard 100 certification which means no harmful chemicals were used and eco-friendly to the environment.

Soft and Durable—Linen will get softer with every wash as it is a slender and natural fiber. It has the capability of self-cleaning, so there is no need to wash it frequently. In addition, linen is more durable than cotton plus our sheets has a 170 GSM, which means it will not break down as fast, so you can use it for years if you like.

Feel comfort year-round —Linen is breathable has a nice temperature control feature that can absorb 20% of its weight in moisture before beginning to feel damp or wet which means you'll be cool in summer and cosy in winter. The perfect sheets for hot sleepers.

Package Included—Queen size, 4 piece sheet set includes 1 flat sheet in 90"×102", 1 fitted sheet in 60"×80" and 2 Pillowcases in 20"×30" with envelope closure. The fitted sheet has a 16" deep pocket design with 360° elastic surrounding, suitable for most mattress.

We are using the finest material in production and have mutiple inspections before it arrive on your hand. But there may still have parts we did not considered that unsatisfy you. That's why we are here all the time for you. Just send us a message and we will help you out. Your satisfaction is our motivation.

Do you sell pillowcase or fitted sheet separately? Yes, we do! In fact, we have flat sheet, fitted sheet and pillowcase sold separately for some customer to get additional one for daily replacement. What is the GSM for this product? Our pure linen bedding is 170 GSM. Linen cotton blend bedding is 165 GSM. Can I machine wash and dry this set? What are the temperature recommendation, if so? Yes, you can machine wash it. We recommend to wash it in gentle machine cycle on 85°F with similar colors. Tumble dry at low heat. Ironing on 230°F. Do not dry clean. Do not use detergent that contains bleach or whitener. I find linen pills after wash it. How do i remedy this problem? It's normal to see some lint in the first few washes since it's 100% from natural flax linen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These sheets are very cooling, and feel amazing, I honestly cannot wait to go to bed at night, I look forward to getting between the sheets. Definitely luxury, also if you didn’t know linen fabric has a high frequency so I dream almost every night!!! Definitely look forward to purchasing more as family gifts, I don’t think people know what they are missing out on!!!! One of the best purchases I’ve ever made.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected
reviews.reviewText: Based on other reviews and other brands of linen sheets I expected these to be scratchy, but they were rather soft. The color is perfect, and the fitted sheet works well on my deep mattress.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You should try linen sheets
reviews.reviewText: The product is well constructed with 100% high-quality linen. The pillowcases have an envelope closure so you don’t see the pillow.Linen has the ability to wick moisture, which makes it good for hot sleepers.Wash first before using! The sheets are initially textured/rough-ish.After a few washing, the fabric significantly softens.At this price point, you can’t go wrong, upgrade to linen sheets.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love the feel of linen and these are great. Yes they are expensive but this set was much better priced than any I’ve seen. Linen is anti microbial, resists insects, absorbs 20% of its weight in moisture. They are great for hot sleepers. The look is slightly wrinkled like a casual lived in look which I like. And who cares If there are wrinkles in your sheets. The bottom sheet has elastic all the way around so they do not slip off. They will fit deeper mattresses. Love love love them. Bought a set as a gift and they love them too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Definitely an excellent value, and definitely better than cotton! So cool and comfy
reviews.reviewText: Update 2022: I've had these sheets for close to 2 years now and still love them!-----I live in Arizona and we've had a heat wave for weeks now. My old cotton sheets were smothering to lay on, even without a top sheet - every point where my body came into contact with the bed would become hot and sweaty. I woke up most mornings to gross, damp sheets; kinda felt like sleeping in a swamp.Linen is supposed to be more breathable and ideal for both hot climates and hot sleepers. I'm on a tight budget and the prospect of paying close to $300 for a basic set of linen sheets was unacceptable, given that I've never so much as touched linen before and had no idea if I would like it. I was also kind of desperate to try anything that might make sleeping at night more bearable, so $130 seemed like a good compromise. I did a ton of reading before I bit the bullet and decided that if linen really is so comfortable and does last 5-10 years, or even 20-30 like some people claim, it was worth a try.The price on these is just right. The stitching is admittedly not the best quality, but after just one night using these sheets I know I love linen. No hotspots between me and the bed, no sweat-bogs in the morning, no waking up in the middle of the night to chug water because I sweated myself dry. I got the natural linen color and I love the textural look and feel of them.The texture is actually not as rough as I'd expected, although I certainly wouldn't call it soft. It's very pleasant to sleep on, however - I love the way the linen drapes over me rather than clings, and the way it catches the air when you toss it over the bed. People have different preferences for texture so linen may not be to everyone's taste, but it is to mine. I will probably branch out at some point and try other brands, but I'm very glad I tried this brand first. It's definitely a huge improvement over my old sheets and a great value.----------A few brief points to make:1. I've never tried any other brand of linen, so I can't speak to the quality compared to others.2. I can say that compared to cotton, these sheets are a godsend. They didn't just absorb sweat better than cotton, I actually sweated less. They feel cool to the touch when I crawl into bed in the evening, and stay that way.3. Although the stitching is not the best I've seen, it's not bad, either. These sheets are worth it if you live in a hot climate or would like to try linen for any other reason. The pockets seem huge and I wasn't sure they would fit properly on my bed, but the elastic is generous enough that it cinched all the extra fabric neatly under the mattress - no chance that the corners will pop off while I sleep. The pillowcases do have an envelope closure.4. I've read some reviews about a bad odor when you first open the package; mine were fine and went directly on the bed.5. I've also read reviews about holes developing in the fabric too soon; I can't speak to that yet, but I'll update later as these sheets age.I will say that linen is said to be more durable than cotton overall, but not as elastic; if you use high heat or crease your sheets too much (throwing them into the dryer in a tangled wad, folding them too tightly in storage, etc) the creases are prone to giving out because the fibers break. I don't know if that has any relevance, but it's good to know for general care. I've also read that fabric softener stiffens the fabric as well as making it less breathable and absorbent; that may also be a factor. If these sheets develop holes even without excessive creasing and fabric softener, I'll make a note of it as that would be a serious quality issue.Long review, but I'm kind of astounded by how well linen sheets breathe. It may actually be a life-changer if I sleep this well every night.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s Excellent and well worth it. Coming from someone picky.
reviews.reviewText: Feels great if you like the feel of linen. The quality is great and held up great following wash instructions. Wrinkles easy so have a steamer handy if you want it pressed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love these sheets, they look awesome on the bed and are amazing to sleep on. Coziest sheets ever. Very happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars True linen, but rough around the edges
reviews.reviewText: These sheets are true, quality linen. They're thick, durable, natural, and attractive. However, they are not particularly comfortable. In fact, I'd say they are in the third string of most comfortable sheets I own. Tiny flax nubs stick out like rough paper edges. At night I am often woken up just because of the texture of the sheets. They aren't horribly uncomfortable, just mildly irritating. I have no doubt that the ad copy is correct, and these will soften with time. I'm just saying, I have three other linen bedclothes purchased around the same time, such as a Levtex duvet cover, and they're all notably softer. Most nights I kick off this DAPU bedsheet and just sleep beneath the Levtex duvet cover. That gives me less temperature control than I'd like but that's how it goes. I'm thinking about washing these sheets five times in a row and see if it helps.
Good sheets and would recommend to other to purchase at the offered price.

These are absolutely beautiful and extremely well made. The pockets are very deep and pillow cases are perfectly sized. I washed with baking soda to soften them up a little before using and it worked well. I know they will continue to soften up with continued use and washing. They are lovely! Seem a lot better made than what they cost so I will definitely be buying more of these. And so comfy to sleep in - breathable yet cozy. Very happy with this purchase :-)
First set lasted me almost 2 years of daily use. Bought this set and other than the pillow cases being slightly too big the quality is excellent.Will buy another set.

reviews.reviewTitle: Not as soft as I would like
reviews.reviewText: These sheets are cool to sleep on. That is great in the middle of this heat wave. I have now washed them several times and I had hoped they might soften up a bit. I am sure that will happen with continued washes.
Doux confortable fit très bien sur matelas épaisGarde le lit plus frais que draps regulierParfait en premenopause !!
